2.text: “How have you helped him who is without power! How have you saved the arm that has no strength!

3.text: How have you counseled him who has no wisdom, and plentifully declared sound knowledge!

4.text: To whom have you uttered words? Whose spirit came forth from you?

5.text: “Those who are deceased tremble, those beneath the waters and all that live in them.

6.text: Sheol is naked before God, and Abaddon has no covering.

7.text: He stretches out the north over empty space, and hangs the earth on nothing.

8.text: He binds up the waters in his thick clouds, and the cloud is not burst under them.

9.text: He encloses the face of his throne, and spreads his cloud on it.

10.text: He has described a boundary on the surface of the waters, and to the confines of light and darkness.

11.text: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his rebuke.

12.text: He stirs up the sea with his power, and by his understanding he strikes through Rahab.

13.text: By his Spirit the heavens are garnished. His hand has pierced the swift serpent.

14.text: Behold, these are but the outskirts of his ways. How small a whisper do we hear of him! But the thunder of his power who can understand?”
